00014 class TCanvasHandleBase;
00015 
00016 /// This is an abstract base class for event displays.  
00017 /// Users need to define a class that derives from this class in order to 
00018 /// make an event display.  The only method that users must implement
00019 /// is the method AddAllCanvas(), where the user defines which tabs to use.
00020 /// 
00021 /// The user then needs to define how they what to update and plot histograms.
00022 /// The updating of histograms happens for each event.
00023 /// In online mode, the plotting of histograms only happens for each XX events;
00024 /// for offline mode the plotting happens for each event.
00025 ///
00026 /// There are two ways that users can decide to update and plot histograms:
00027 ///
00028 /// 1) They can create histograms in their event display class and then fill 
00029 ///    the methods UpdateHistograms(TDataContainer) and PlotCanvas(TDataContainer).
00030 ///    This histograms can then file in the canvases that are added using 
00031 ///    AddSingleCanvas(std::string name).
00032 ///
00033 /// 2) They can create classes that are derived from TCanvasHandleBase.  The derived
00034 ///    classes are then added using the method AddSingleCanvas(TCanvasHandleBase* handleClass).
00035 ///    
00036 /// There is no substantial difference between the two methods.  The second method
00037 /// is mainly meant to allow the user to separate the methods into separate files
00038 /// for code cleaniness.
00039 ///
00040 /// Examples of both these methods are available in examples/display_example.cxx
00041 ///
00042 /// The actual ROOT GUI is encapsulated in a separate class TMainDisplayWindow.
00043 /// The TRootanaDisplay has an instance of this TMainDisplayWindow class.
00044 /// Users will be need to access the TMainDisplayWindow by calling
00045 ///
00046 /// TRootanaDisplay::GetDisplayWindow()
00047 /// 
00048 /// in order to grab the particular canvas that we want plot on.
00049 ///
00050 ///
00051 class TRootanaDisplay: public TRootanaEventLoop {
00052 
00053 
00054 public:
00055 
00056   TRootanaDisplay();
00057 
00058   virtual ~TRootanaDisplay();
00059 
00060   /// User must 
00061   virtual void AddAllCanvases() = 0;
00062 
00063   /// Add a new canvas; user will interactively fill it.
00064   void AddSingleCanvas(std::string name){
00065     fMainWindow->AddCanvas(name);
00066   }
00067 
00068   /// Add a new canvas, using a TCanvasHandleBase class.
00069   /// TRootanaDisplay will take ownership of pointer
00070   /// and delete memory it points to.
00071   void AddSingleCanvas(TCanvasHandleBase* handleClass);
00072 
00073 
00074   /// Retrieve the main display window, so that users can 
00075   /// do things like grab the canvases and update them.
00076   TMainDisplayWindow* GetDisplayWindow(){ return fMainWindow;}
00077 
00078   /// This method can be implemented by users to update user histograms.
00079   virtual void UpdateHistograms(TDataContainer& dataContainer){};
00080   
00081   /// This method can be implemented by users to plotting of current canvas
00082   virtual void PlotCanvas(TDataContainer& dataContainer){};
00083 
00084   /// This method can be implemented by users to plotting of current canvas
00085   virtual void ResetHistograms(){};
00086 
00087   /// Method for when next button is pushed (offline mode)
00088   void NextButtonPushed(){
00089     waitingForNextButton = false;
00090   }
00091   /// Method for when skip event button is pushed (online mode)
00092   void EventSkipButtonPushed(){
00093     fNumberSkipEventsOnline = fMainWindow->GetSkipEventButton()->GetNumberEntry()->GetIntNumber();
00094   }
00095 
00096   /// This method calls a couple other methods for resets the histograms.
00097   /// This method is attached using the ROOT signal/input system to the reset
00098   /// button on the canvas.
00099   void Reset();
00100 
00101   // This is a generic action to call when some button gets pushed.
00102   // Also called in regular event handling loop
00103   void UpdatePlotsAction();
00104 
00105   /// Function so that user can specify at outset how many events to skip before
00106   /// refreshing display (in online mode).
00107   void SetNumberSkipEvent(int number){
00108     fNumberSkipEventsOnline = number;
00109     if(fMainWindow->GetSkipEventButton())
00110       fMainWindow->GetSkipEventButton()->GetNumberEntry()->SetIntNumber(number);
00111   }
00112 
00113   /// Get Display name
00114   std::string GetDisplayName(){return fDisplayName;}
00115   /// Set Display name
00116   void SetDisplayName(std::string name){fDisplayName = name;}
00117   
00118   void Initialize(){
00119     InitializeMainWindow();
00120   }
00121 
00122 
00123 private:
00124 
00125   /// Method to initialize the Main display window.
00126   void InitializeMainWindow();
00127 
00128   // Variable to keep track of waiting for next event button (offline mode)
00129   bool waitingForNextButton; 
00130 
00131   /// Variable to keep track of how many events to skip before updating display;
00132   /// we have separate variable for online and offline modes.
00133   int fNumberSkipEventsOnline;
00134 
00135   // Variable to keep track of number of processed events.
00136   int fNumberProcessed;
00137 
00138   /// The pointer to our display window
00139   TMainDisplayWindow* fMainWindow;
00140 
00141   /// Process each midas event
00142   bool ProcessMidasEvent(TDataContainer& dataContainer);
00143 
00144   /// Called before the first event of a file is read, but you should prefer
00145   /// Initialize() for general initialization.  This method will be called
00146   /// once for each input file.  
00147   void BeginRun(int transition,int run,int time);
00148   
00149   /// Called after the last event of a file is read, but you should prefer
00150   /// Finalize() for general finalization.  This method will be called once
00151   /// for each input file.
00152   void EndRun(int transition,int run,int time);
00153   
00154 
00155   /// We keep a cached copy of the midas event (so that it can used for callback).
00156   TDataContainer* fCachedDataContainer;
00157 
00158   /// Set the cached copy of midas dataContainer.
00159   /// !!! This is very questionable!  Caching each dataContainer might add a considerable overhead
00160   /// to the processing!
00161   void SetCachedDataContainer(TDataContainer& dataContainer){
00162     if(fCachedDataContainer) delete fCachedDataContainer;
00163     fCachedDataContainer = new TDataContainer(dataContainer);
00164   }
00165 
00166   /// Display name
00167   std::string fDisplayName;
00168 
00169   /// This is a vector of user-defined canvas handler classes.
00170   /// The first part of pair is the tab number.
00171   std::vector< std::pair<int,TCanvasHandleBase*> > fCanvasHandlers;
00172 
00173   ClassDef(TRootanaDisplay,1)
